abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental assessment identifies
            major adverse impacts as a result of the Water Sector
            Investment Loan Project in Tunisia, but does not explicitly
            identify social issues. It does however, cover institutional
            arrangements, budget estimates, and monitoring, and
            evaluation of actions. Mitigation will ensure a sustained
            use of soil resources in irrigation, through studies on
            systematic rapid assessment of soil salinization, and soil
            degradation, to be carried out by the Directorate of Soils,
            and, to improve water resources, studies conducted by the
            Ministry of Environment, will focus on water pollution
            analysis, with support from consulting firms. Institutional,
            and legal measures include staff training in environmental,
            and social assessment requirements, regarding irrigation
            development, groundwater management, and rural water supply,
            as well as a review of contracting environmental clauses.
            Specific measures will: design, and protect terraces to
            minimize surface erosion; avoid water logging, and improve
            drainage to periodically flush spoils; prod cultivation of
            salinity tolerance crops; ensure quality of waste water used
            in irrigation; protect soil surfaces with mulch; establish
            adequate drainage channels, and re-vegetate eroded surfaces;
            include precautionary measures to collect, and recycle
            lubricants to prevent accidental spillage; and, waste, and
            sediments will be disposed of in accordance to environmental measures.
